motorcycle: A vehicle with two wheels and an engine.
banana: A long, curved fruit with a yellow skin and soft, sweet, white flesh inside.
hammer: A tool consisting of a piece of metal with a flat end that is fixed onto the end of a long, thin, usually wooden handle, used for hitting things.
speaker: A person who gives a speech at a public event.
orang-utan: A large ape with reddish-brown hair and long arms that lives in the forests of sumatra and borneo.
spoon: An object consisting of a round, hollow part and a handle, used for mixing, serving, and eating food.
keyboard: The set of keys on a computer or typewriter that you press in order to make it work .
monitor: A person who has the job of watching or noticing particular things.
bookcase: A piece of furniture with shelves to put books on.
book: A written text that can be published in printed or electronic form.
light: The brightness that comes from the sun, fire, etc. and from electrical devices, and that allows things to be seen.
traffic: The number of vehicles moving along roads, or the amount of aircraft, trains, or ships moving along a route.
traffic jam: A large number of vehicles close together and unable to move or moving very slowly.
chair: A seat for one person that has a back, usually four legs, and sometimes two arms.
elephant: A very large gray mammal that has a trunk (= long nose) with which it can pick things up.
hippopotamus: A very large animal with short legs and thick, dark gray skin that lives near water in africa.
